key_points: At least 31 law-enforcement officers are suspected of involvement in the Capitol riot.
Several off-duty police officers and members of the US military were involved in the attack.
Police departments are under pressure to screen recruits for affiliations with white-nationalist groups.
Investigators are determining whether officers only attended the rally or participated in the violence.
The unrest resulted in the death of a Capitol Police officer, a Trump supporter, and three others due to medical emergencies.
Officers under investigation come from various locations including Los Angeles and Oklahoma.
Two Seattle police officers are on leave pending investigation into their involvement in the riot.
Virginia police officers Jacob Fracker and Thomas Robertson were arrested after posting a selfie inside the Capitol.
The FBI has initiated a widespread investigation to identify and arrest those involved in the riot.
Concerns are raised about the infiltration of police forces by white-nationalist and far-right groups.
